snippet: Part of the vast Great Barrier Reef in Australia has flourished in a sediment-filled environment, which was thought to be detrimental.
abstract: Dr Chris Perry study in journal Geology finds that the muddy, sediment-filled Middle Reef, part of Australia's Great Barrier Reef, has grown more rapidly than other segments; findings contradict belief that sediment-rich marine environments are detrimental to coral growth.
lead_paragraph: Part of the vast Great Barrier Reef in Australia has flourished in a sediment-filled environment, which was thought to be detrimental.

headline.print_headline: Mud Posed No Obstacle To a Coral Reef’s Growth
headline.seo: Coral Seen Growing in Sediment-Rich Middle Reef
headline.main: Mud Posed No Obstacle to a Coral Reef’s Growth
